Introduction:Carroms is a classic board game.we tried to make the game with the concepts which we have learned from the CS101 course. 
	     We used 'simplecpp' as our source of compilers and also for graphics.
	     This is a strategy game for 2 players.
	     Instead of keyboard mouse is used as an input device.
	     The game contains 9 black coins and a striker to strike.
	     The main goal of a player is to end up with maximum coins in the holes.
	     The first click of the mouse will set the striker and the next click will simultaneously give both speed and direction.
 	     The score gets updated on the terminal after every players turn.


System requirements:This is designed for windows OS(32 or 64 bit) & Ubuntu (not tested on mac and linux)



Installation:It runs on codeblocks with included libraries(simplecpp).
	     Get Full Version of Codeblocks from "http://www.cse.iitb.ac.in/~ranade/simplecpp/CB-Simplecpp-setup.exe"



Configaration:http://www.it.iitb.ac.in/frg/wiki/images/e/e8/CodeBlockManual.pdf



Compile and Runing program: Open the file located in 'source' with codeblocks.
			    Click 'compile' button or 'Ctrl + f9' to compile the code.
			    Click 'run' button or 'Ctrl+f10' to run the code.
			    Alternatively you can click 'compile & run' or 'f9' to do both at once.
